name: ENERGY STAR Res. ASHP (FS)

market_entry_year_source.notes: Standard and corresponding ENERGY STAR spec goes into effect in 2023

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Program Requirements Product Specification for Central Air Conditioner and Heat Pump Equipment Version 6.1

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Split system (see Table 2 in EPA source); conversion from original standard: COP = SEER / 3.412, COP = HSPF / 3.412 (see EIA source); split system conversion factors SEER2/SEER = 0.95, HSPF2/HSPF = 0.85 (see RESNET source)

source_data.title: ENERGY STAR Program Requirements Product Specification for Central Air Conditioner and Heat Pump Equipment Version 6.1
Draft PDS-01, MINHERS Addendum 71, SEER2/HSPF2 Conversions
Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation 2014

installed_cost_source.notes: Total installed cost for ENERGY STAR ASHPs in 2023. For existing buildings, added costs of $6300 are the average of the cost range for circuit breaker panel upgrade and home service upgrade costs in the NV5 report, a new circuit cost of 700 $2022 using the upper bound (assuming a high amperage 240V circuit is required for the HVAC system) from the NV5 report, and additional tank removal costs of 800 2014$ (975 2022$) are applied for distillate and propane based on the 2015 EIA report, updating the cost from April 2014 to April 2022.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
Residential End Uses: Area 2: Incremental Installed Costs for Efficiency Upgrades
Service Upgrades for Electrification Retrofits Study Final Report
source_data.author: Shoshana Pena, Collin Smith, Greg Butsko, Rick Gardner, Sean Armstrong, Emily Higbee, Dylan Anderson, Rebecca Hueckel

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average ENERGY STAR equipment lifetime in 2023, rounded down from 15.3

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies

market_scaling_fractions_source.heating: Applies to all residential fuel-fired heating; no electric heating is switched by this ECM

cooling.title: RECS 2020 Microdata
cooling.fraction_derivation: Central AC multiple of 68% was determined as a proportion of total homes with a ducted cooling system where heating is done using any non-electric heating energy source. Total homes with ducted cooling (main air conditioning equipment type = central AC = 1) in the sample is 12,211 homes, and then filtered for homes with non-electric heating system (Main space heating fuel != electricity = 5) 12,211-3,949 homes.

_description: Standard size residential air source heat pump that meets the ENERGY STAR performance standard, non-cold-climate
